intro: Kolowratia congesta, commonly known as the clustered starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to parts of Europe and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, similar to other members of the carrot family. Kolowratia congesta is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
